etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Brande's Journal. From French gaylussite from Gay-Luss- (in the name of J.-L. Gay-Lussac) + -ite

definitions: A carbonate mineral found as white or yellowish crystals and associated chiefly with evaporite deposits formed from freshwater lakes.

notes.text: Gaylussite is a double carbonate of sodium and calcium, Na₂Ca(CO₃)₂.5H₂O. Crystal system: monoclinic.
